BryanCutler commented on pull request #5345: ARROW-6519: [Java] Use IPC continuation token to write 8-byte EOS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5345
 
 
   This changes the 8-byte EOS for non-legacy stream format to use {0xFFFFFFFF, 0x00000000} instead of all zeros. When using all zeros, the reader will not know to read the last 4-bytes, but with the 4-byte continuation token, all bytes written to a channel can be read.

fields.description: For Arrow stream in non-legacy mode, the EOS identifier should be \{0xFFFFFFFF, 0x00000000}. This way, all bytes sent by the writer can be read.
